name: Kepler-24
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-24 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-24 is a star with 1.67 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.29 times its radius. It is located 3900.79 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-24 is known to have 4 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-24 b

Kepler-24 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2012-05. Its semi-major axis is 0.08 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 8.15 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-24.

The mass of Kepler-24 b is 508.50 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-24 b is 2.4 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, Kepler-24 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.

Kepler-24 c

Kepler-24 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2012-05. Its semi-major axis is 0.11 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 12.33 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-24.

The mass of Kepler-24 c is 508.50 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-24 c is 2.8 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, Kepler-24 c is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.

Kepler-24 d

Kepler-24 d was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.05 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 4.24 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-24.

The mass of Kepler-24 d is 3.29 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-24 d is 1.67 that of Earth. At 3.29 Earth masses, Kepler-24 d is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Kepler-24 e

Kepler-24 e was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.14 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 19.00 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-24.

The mass of Kepler-24 e is 11.19 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-24 e is 2.78 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-24 e is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-24, which contains 4 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
